### [1021] [kTULA: A Langevin sampling algorithm with improved KL bounds under super-linear log-gradients](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.04878)
*Iosif Lytras,Sotirios Sabanis,Ying Zhang*

Main category: math.ST

TL;DR: 论文提出了一种名为kTULA的新算法，用于解决深度学习中超线性增长对数梯度分布的采样问题，并提供了理论性能保证。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 深度学习应用中，全局Lipschitz连续性条件常不满足，需解决超线性增长对数梯度的分布采样问题。

Method: 提出基于tamed Langevin dynamics的kTULA算法，并建立其非渐近收敛性理论。

Result: 在KL散度中取得最佳收敛速率$2-\overline{\epsilon}$，显著优于现有文献，并进一步改进了Wasserstein-2距离误差界。

Conclusion: kTULA在采样高维双势阱分布和神经网络优化问题中表现优异，理论结果为其性能提供了保证。

Abstract: Motivated by applications in deep learning, where the global Lipschitz
continuity condition is often not satisfied, we examine the problem of sampling
from distributions with super-linearly growing log-gradients. We propose a
novel tamed Langevin dynamics-based algorithm, called kTULA, to solve the
aforementioned sampling problem, and provide a theoretical guarantee for its
performance. More precisely, we establish a non-asymptotic convergence bound in
Kullback-Leibler (KL) divergence with the best-known rate of convergence equal
to $2-\overline{\epsilon}$, $\overline{\epsilon}>0$, which significantly
improves relevant results in existing literature. This enables us to obtain an
improved non-asymptotic error bound in Wasserstein-2 distance, which can be
used to further derive a non-asymptotic guarantee for kTULA to solve the
associated optimization problems. To illustrate the applicability of kTULA, we
apply the proposed algorithm to the problem of sampling from a high-dimensional
double-well potential distribution and to an optimization problem involving a
neural network. We show that our main results can be used to provide
theoretical guarantees for the performance of kTULA.

</details>


### [1022] [kTULA: A Langevin sampling algorithm with improved KL bounds under super-linear log-gradients](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.04878)
*Iosif Lytras,Sotirios Sabanis,Ying Zhang*

Main category: math.ST

TL;DR: 论文提出了一种名为kTULA的新算法，用于解决深度学习中超线性增长对数梯度的分布采样问题，并提供了理论性能保证。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 深度学习应用中，全局Lipschitz连续性条件常不满足，需研究超线性增长对数梯度的分布采样问题。

Method: 提出基于驯服朗之万动力学的新算法kTULA，并分析其性能。

Result: 在KL散度中建立了非渐近收敛界，收敛速率为$2-\overline{\epsilon}$，显著优于现有结果。

Conclusion: kTULA在采样和优化问题中表现优异，理论结果为其性能提供了保证。

Abstract: Motivated by applications in deep learning, where the global Lipschitz
continuity condition is often not satisfied, we examine the problem of sampling
from distributions with super-linearly growing log-gradients. We propose a
novel tamed Langevin dynamics-based algorithm, called kTULA, to solve the
aforementioned sampling problem, and provide a theoretical guarantee for its
performance. More precisely, we establish a non-asymptotic convergence bound in
Kullback-Leibler (KL) divergence with the best-known rate of convergence equal
to $2-\overline{\epsilon}$, $\overline{\epsilon}>0$, which significantly
improves relevant results in existing literature. This enables us to obtain an
improved non-asymptotic error bound in Wasserstein-2 distance, which can be
used to further derive a non-asymptotic guarantee for kTULA to solve the
associated optimization problems. To illustrate the applicability of kTULA, we
apply the proposed algorithm to the problem of sampling from a high-dimensional
double-well potential distribution and to an optimization problem involving a
neural network. We show that our main results can be used to provide
theoretical guarantees for the performance of kTULA.

</details>

### [1023] [Unveiling Voices: A Co-Hashtag Analysis of TikTok Discourse on the 2023 Israel-Palestine Crisis](https://arxiv.org/abs/2501.07182)
*Rozin Hasin*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: 研究探讨了TikTok上关于2023年巴勒斯坦危机的讨论，发现政治立场不同的用户通过关键词网络分析表现出明显的对立。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 探讨TikTok作为社交媒体平台在政治议题中的影响，尤其是巴勒斯坦危机中的用户行为。

Method: 采用网络分析方法，对代表冲突的关键词进行分类，基于政治和意识形态立场编码。

Result: 发现TikTok上存在明显的政治对立，表现为活动宣传与宣传内容的竞争。

Conclusion: TikTok为政治对立提供了空间，活动宣传与宣传内容在其中激烈竞争。

Abstract: TikTok has gradually become one of the most pervasive social media platforms
in our daily lives. While much can be said about the merits of platforms such
as TikTok, there is a different kind of attention paid towards the political
affect of social media today compared to its impact on other aspects of modern
networked reality. I explored how users on TikTok discussed the crisis in
Palestine that worsened in 2023. Using network analysis, I situate keywords
representing the conflict and categorize them thematically based on a coding
schema derived from politically and ideologically differentiable stances. I
conclude that activism and propaganda are contending amongst themselves in the
thriving space afforded by TikTok today.

</details>


### [1024] [GARG-AML against Smurfing: A Scalable and Interpretable Graph-Based Framework for Anti-Money Laundering](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.04292)
*Bruno Deprez,Bart Baesens,Tim Verdonck,Wouter Verbeke*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: 论文提出了一种名为GARG-AML的新型图分析方法，通过量化每个节点在二阶交易网络中的结构风险，提供了一种可解释的单一指标，用于检测洗钱中的拆分交易（smurfing）行为。该方法在计算效率、检测能力和透明度之间取得了平衡，并通过实验验证了其优于现有方法。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 洗钱行为占全球GDP的2%-5%，拆分交易（smurfing）作为一种常见的洗钱手段，其复杂性使得传统方法难以有效检测。现有方法多为黑箱模型，限制了其在商业中的应用。因此，需要一种透明且高效的方法来检测此类行为。

Method: GARG-AML通过分析每个节点在二阶交易网络中的结构特征，生成一个可解释的风险评分。该方法结合了树模型和邻居节点的评分，仅需邻接矩阵和基本网络特征即可实现高效检测。

Result: 实验表明，GARG-AML在大规模合成和开源网络上的表现优于现有方法，能够有效检测拆分交易行为。

Conclusion: GARG-AML展示了基础网络特性在欺诈检测中的潜力，为反洗钱工作流程提供了一种透明且高效的解决方案。

Abstract: Money laundering poses a significant challenge as it is estimated to account
for 2%-5% of the global GDP. This has compelled regulators to impose stringent
controls on financial institutions. One prominent laundering method for evading
these controls, called smurfing, involves breaking up large transactions into
smaller amounts. Given the complexity of smurfing schemes, which involve
multiple transactions distributed among diverse parties, network analytics has
become an important anti-money laundering tool. However, recent advances have
focused predominantly on black-box network embedding methods, which has
hindered their adoption in businesses. In this paper, we introduce GARG-AML, a
novel graph-based method that quantifies smurfing risk through a single
interpretable metric derived from the structure of the second-order transaction
network of each individual node in the network. Unlike traditional methods,
GARG-AML strikes an effective balance among computational efficiency, detection
power and transparency, which enables its integration into existing AML
workflows. To enhance its capabilities, we combine the GARG-AML score
calculation with different tree-based methods and also incorporate the scores
of the node's neighbours. An experimental evaluation on large-scale synthetic
and open-source networks demonstrate that the GARG-AML outperforms the current
state-of-the-art smurfing detection methods. By leveraging only the adjacency
matrix of the second-order neighbourhood and basic network features, this work
highlights the potential of fundamental network properties towards advancing
fraud detection.

</details>


### [1025] [Unveiling Voices: A Co-Hashtag Analysis of TikTok Discourse on the 2023 Israel-Palestine Crisis](https://arxiv.org/abs/2501.07182)
*Rozin Hasin*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: 论文探讨了TikTok上关于2023年巴勒斯坦危机的讨论，通过网络分析和主题分类，发现平台上存在活动宣传与政治宣传的竞争。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 研究TikTok作为主流社交媒体平台在政治议题中的影响力，特别是巴勒斯坦危机中的用户讨论。

Method: 使用网络分析技术，对代表冲突的关键词进行主题分类，基于政治和意识形态立场的编码框架。

Result: 发现TikTok上活动宣传与政治宣传之间存在竞争。

Conclusion: TikTok为政治宣传和活动宣传提供了活跃的空间，两者在平台上相互竞争。

Abstract: TikTok has gradually become one of the most pervasive social media platforms
in our daily lives. While much can be said about the merits of platforms such
as TikTok, there is a different kind of attention paid towards the political
affect of social media today compared to its impact on other aspects of modern
networked reality. I explored how users on TikTok discussed the crisis in
Palestine that worsened in 2023. Using network analysis, I situate keywords
representing the conflict and categorize them thematically based on a coding
schema derived from politically and ideologically differentiable stances. I
conclude that activism and propaganda are contending amongst themselves in the
thriving space afforded by TikTok today.

</details>


### [1026] [GARG-AML against Smurfing: A Scalable and Interpretable Graph-Based Framework for Anti-Money Laundering](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.04292)
*Bruno Deprez,Bart Baesens,Tim Verdonck,Wouter Verbeke*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: 论文提出了一种名为GARG-AML的新型图分析方法，用于量化洗钱风险，通过单一可解释的指标检测拆分交易（smurfing）。该方法在计算效率、检测能力和透明度之间取得了平衡，优于现有方法。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 洗钱占全球GDP的2%-5%，拆分交易（smurfing）是一种常见手段，但现有方法多为黑盒网络嵌入，难以被企业采用。

Method: GARG-AML通过分析二阶交易网络的结构，生成单一可解释的风险指标，并结合树方法和邻居节点分数提升检测能力。

Result: 实验表明，GARG-AML在大规模合成和开源网络上优于现有方法。

Conclusion: GARG-AML展示了基础网络属性在欺诈检测中的潜力，可集成到现有反洗钱流程中。

Abstract: Money laundering poses a significant challenge as it is estimated to account

controls on financial institutions. One prominent laundering method for evading
these controls, called smurfing, involves breaking up large transactions into
smaller amounts. Given the complexity of smurfing schemes, which involve
multiple transactions distributed among diverse parties, network analytics has
become an important anti-money laundering tool. However, recent advances have
focused predominantly on black-box network embedding methods, which has
hindered their adoption in businesses. In this paper, we introduce GARG-AML, a

interpretable metric derived from the structure of the second-order transaction
network of each individual node in the network. Unlike traditional methods,
GARG-AML strikes an effective balance among computational efficiency, detection
power and transparency, which enables its integration into existing AML
workflows. To enhance its capabilities, we combine the GARG-AML score
calculation with different tree-based methods and also incorporate the scores
of the node's neighbours. An experimental evaluation on large-scale synthetic
and open-source networks demonstrate that the GARG-AML outperforms the current
state-of-the-art smurfing detection methods. By leveraging only the adjacency
matrix of the second-order neighbourhood and basic network features, this work
highlights the potential of fundamental network properties towards advancing
fraud detection.

</details>

### [1027] [Bilevel Optimization for Improved Flexibility Aggregation Models of Electric Vehicle Fleets](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.04843)
*Philipp Härtel,Michael von Bonin*

Main category: math.OC

TL;DR: 本文提出了一种双层优化方法，用于提升电动汽车车队的灵活性聚合，通过内外层优化减少调度偏差并提高利润。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 电动汽车车队作为电力系统灵活性的重要来源，但其异构性导致灵活性潜力难以准确捕捉。

Method: 采用双层优化框架，外层最小化调度偏差，内层最大化利润，并引入时间尺度映射参数化聚合单元。

Result: 与简单聚合方法相比，充电功率的均方根误差减少了78%，灵活性表示更准确。

Conclusion: 该框架为未来研究提供了扩展基础，显著提升了电动汽车灵活性聚合的准确性。

Abstract: Electric vehicle (EV) fleets are expected to become an increasingly important
source of flexibility for power system operations. However, accurately
capturing the flexibility potential of numerous and heterogeneous EVs remains a
significant challenge. We propose a bilevel optimization formulation to enhance
flexibility aggregations of electric vehicle fleets. The outer level minimizes
scheduling deviations between the aggregated and reference EV units, while the
inner level maximizes the aggregated unit's profits. Our approach introduces
hourly to daily scaling factor mappings to parameterize the aggregated EV
units. Compared to simple aggregation methods, the proposed framework reduces
the root-mean-square error of charging power by 78~per cent, providing more
accurate flexibility representations. The proposed framework also provides a
foundation for several potential extensions in future work.

</details>


### [1028] [Regularization of non-overshooting quasi-continuous sliding mode control for chattering suppression at equilibrium](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.05283)
*Michael Ruderman,Denis Efimov*

Main category: math.OC

TL;DR: 本文提出了一种正则化方案，用于抑制二阶系统中非过冲准连续滑模控制的固有抖振，并提供了ISS和iISS证明及数值结果支持。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 解决二阶系统中非过冲准连续滑模控制在原点处因不连续性导致的抖振问题，以提升实际应用中的性能。

Method: 提出正则化方案，结合ISS（输入到状态稳定）和iISS（积分输入到状态稳定）理论进行分析。

Result: 通过数值结果验证了正则化方案的有效性，能够有效抑制抖振。

Conclusion: 该方案为二阶系统的非过冲准连续滑模控制提供了实用的改进方法，适用于实际应用。

Abstract: Robust finite-time feedback controller introduced for the second-order
systems in [1] can be seen as a non-overshooting quasi-continuous sliding mode
control. The paper proposes a regularization scheme to suppress inherent
chattering due to discontinuity of the control [1] in the origin, in favor of
practical applications. A detailed analysis with ISS and iISS proofs are
provided along with supporting numerical results.

</details>


### [1029] [Was Residual Penalty and Neural Operators All We Needed for Solving Optimal Control Problems?](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.04742)
*Oliver G. S. Lundqvist,Fabricio Oliveira*

Main category: math.OC

TL;DR: 论文提出了一种简化神经网络解决最优控制问题的方法，通过分离训练过程和优化问题，无需在训练中包含成本函数。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 传统方法在训练神经网络时需结合数据、微分方程残差和目标成本，导致架构复杂。本文旨在简化这一过程。

Method: 使用DeepONet等简单神经算子架构，结合无约束优化程序，通过微分方程残差的惩罚项和自动微分计算控制梯度。

Result: 在九个不同的最优控制问题上验证了方法的有效性，展示了准确且一致的性能。

Conclusion: 研究表明，简化架构和分离训练与优化过程可以高效解决多种最优控制问题。

Abstract: Neural networks have been used to solve optimal control problems, typically
by training neural networks using a combined loss function that considers data,
differential equation residuals, and objective costs. We show that including
cost functions in the training process is unnecessary, advocating for a simpler
architecture and streamlined approach by decoupling the optimal control problem
from the training process. Thus, our work shows that a simple neural operator
architecture, such as DeepONet, coupled with an unconstrained optimization
routine, can solve multiple optimal control problems with a single
physics-informed training phase and a subsequent optimization phase. We achieve
this by adding a penalty term based on the differential equation residual to
the cost function and computing gradients with respect to the control using
automatic differentiation through the trained neural operator within an
iterative optimization routine. We showcase our method on nine distinct optimal
control problems by training three separate DeepONet models, each corresponding
to a different differential equation. For each model, we solve three problems
with varying cost functions, demonstrating accurate and consistent performance
across all cases.

</details>


### [1030] [Non-linear Multi-objective Optimization with Probabilistic Branch and Bound](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.04554)
*Hao Huang,Zelda B. Zabinsky*

Main category: math.OC

TL;DR: 提出了一种名为MOPBnB(so)的多目标模拟优化算法，用于近似随机多目标优化问题的帕累托最优集和高效前沿。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 解决随机多目标优化问题中传统方法计算资源消耗大的问题。

Method: MOPBnB(so)在任一解处仅评估一次噪声函数，并利用邻近解估计目标函数。

Result: 算法在确定性问题上具有有限时间性能分析，且在随机问题上渐近收敛。数值结果表明其计算效率优于多复制变体和NSGA-II。

Conclusion: MOPBnB(so)在计算效率和性能上优于传统方法，适用于随机多目标优化问题。

Abstract: A multiple objective simulation optimization algorithm named Multiple
Objective Probabilistic Branch and Bound with Single Observation (MOPBnB(so))
is presented for approximating the Pareto optimal set and the associated
efficient frontier for stochastic multi-objective optimization problems.
MOPBnB(so) evaluates a noisy function exactly once at any solution and uses
neighboring solutions to estimate the objective functions, in contrast to a
variant that uses multiple replications at a solution to estimate the objective
functions. A finite-time performance analysis for deterministic multi-objective
problems provides a bound on the probability that MOPBnB(so) captures the
Pareto optimal set. Asymptotic convergence of MOPBnB(so) on stochastic problems
is derived, in that the algorithm captures the Pareto optimal set and the
estimations converge to the true objective function values. Numerical results
reveal that the variant with multiple replications is extremely intensive in
terms of computational resources compared to MOPBnB(so). In addition, numerical
results show that MOPBnB(so) outperforms a genetic algorithm NSGA-II on test
problems.

</details>

<details>

Abstract: Electric vehicle (EV) fleets are expected to become an increasingly important
source of flexibility for power system operations. However, accurately
capturing the flexibility potential of numerous and heterogeneous EVs remains a
significant challenge. We propose a bilevel optimization formulation to enhance
flexibility aggregations of electric vehicle fleets. The outer level minimizes

### [1033] [Was Residual Penalty and Neural Operators All We Needed for Solving Optimal Control Problems?](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.04742)
*Oliver G. S. Lundqvist,Fabricio Oliveira*

Main category: math.OC

TL;DR: 论文提出了一种简化神经网络解决最优控制问题的方法，通过分离训练和优化过程，无需在训练中考虑成本函数。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 传统方法在训练神经网络时需结合数据、微分方程残差和目标成本，增加了复杂性。本文旨在简化架构，提高效率。

Method: 使用简单神经算子架构（如DeepONet）结合无约束优化方法，通过微分方程残差的惩罚项和自动微分计算控制梯度。

Result: 在九个不同最优控制问题上验证了方法的准确性和一致性，仅需三个DeepONet模型。

Conclusion: 该方法简化了最优控制问题的解决流程，证明了单一训练阶段和后续优化的有效性。

Abstract: Neural networks have been used to solve optimal control problems, typically
by training neural networks using a combined loss function that considers data,
differential equation residuals, and objective costs. We show that including
cost functions in the training process is unnecessary, advocating for a simpler
architecture and streamlined approach by decoupling the optimal control problem
from the training process. Thus, our work shows that a simple neural operator
architecture, such as DeepONet, coupled with an unconstrained optimization
routine, can solve multiple optimal control problems with a single
physics-informed training phase and a subsequent optimization phase. We achieve
this by adding a penalty term based on the differential equation residual to
the cost function and computing gradients with respect to the control using
automatic differentiation through the trained neural operator within an
iterative optimization routine. We showcase our method on nine distinct optimal
control problems by training three separate DeepONet models, each corresponding
to a different differential equation. For each model, we solve three problems
with varying cost functions, demonstrating accurate and consistent performance
across all cases.

</details>


### [1034] [Non-linear Multi-objective Optimization with Probabilistic Branch and Bound](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.04554)
*Hao Huang,Zelda B. Zabinsky*

Main category: math.OC

TL;DR: MOPBnB(so)是一种多目标仿真优化算法，通过单次评估和邻域估计逼近帕累托最优集，计算资源消耗低且性能优于NSGA-II。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 解决随机多目标优化问题中计算资源消耗高的问题，提出一种高效算法。

Method: 使用单次评估和邻域估计目标函数，对比多重复制变体。

Result: 算法在有限时间内逼近帕累托最优集，数值结果显示其计算效率高且优于NSGA-II。

Conclusion: MOPBnB(so)是一种高效且计算资源友好的多目标优化算法。

Abstract: A multiple objective simulation optimization algorithm named Multiple
Objective Probabilistic Branch and Bound with Single Observation (MOPBnB(so))
is presented for approximating the Pareto optimal set and the associated
efficient frontier for stochastic multi-objective optimization problems.
MOPBnB(so) evaluates a noisy function exactly once at any solution and uses
neighboring solutions to estimate the objective functions, in contrast to a
variant that uses multiple replications at a solution to estimate the objective
functions. A finite-time performance analysis for deterministic multi-objective
problems provides a bound on the probability that MOPBnB(so) captures the
Pareto optimal set. Asymptotic convergence of MOPBnB(so) on stochastic problems
is derived, in that the algorithm captures the Pareto optimal set and the
estimations converge to the true objective function values. Numerical results
reveal that the variant with multiple replications is extremely intensive in
terms of computational resources compared to MOPBnB(so). In addition, numerical
results show that MOPBnB(so) outperforms a genetic algorithm NSGA-II on test
problems.

</details>

### [1035] [Computationally Intensive Research: Advancing a Role for Secondary Analysis of Qualitative Data](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.04230)
*Kaveh Mohajeri,Amir Karami*

Main category: cs.DB

TL;DR: 本文探讨了计算技术在重新利用过去定性研究数据中的潜力，提出了计算密集型二次分析的方法，并讨论了其优势与挑战。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 定性研究数据通常丰富但未被充分利用，计算技术可以挖掘其潜在价值，支持跨上下文和纵向研究。

Method: 提出了一种计算密集型二次分析的方案，并探讨如何通过这种方法创新研究设计。

Result: 强调了计算密集型二次分析在跨上下文和纵向研究中的潜力，并列举了相关挑战。

Conclusion: 计算密集型二次分析为定性数据的再利用提供了新机会，但需解决数据共享和重用中的关键问题。

Abstract: This paper draws attention to the potential of computational methods in
reworking data generated in past qualitative studies. While qualitative
inquiries often produce rich data through rigorous and resource-intensive
processes, much of this data usually remains unused. In this paper, we first
make a general case for secondary analysis of qualitative data by discussing
its benefits, distinctions, and epistemological aspects. We then argue for
opportunities with computationally intensive secondary analysis, highlighting
the possibility of drawing on data assemblages spanning multiple contexts and
timeframes to address cross-contextual and longitudinal research phenomena and
questions. We propose a scheme to perform computationally intensive secondary
analysis and advance ideas on how this approach can help facilitate the
development of innovative research designs. Finally, we enumerate some key
challenges and ongoing concerns associated with qualitative data sharing and
reuse.

</details>

TL;DR: 本文探讨了利用计算方法重新利用过去定性研究数据的潜力，提出了计算密集型二次分析的方案，并讨论了相关挑战。

Conclusion: 尽管存在数据共享和重用的挑战，计算密集型二次分析为定性研究提供了新的机遇。
